translated: Points of Controversy
The Fifty on Refutation
16. The section on refutation
Refutation
“Does one person suppress the mind of another?”
“Yes.”

original: Paro parassa cittaṁ “mā rajji”, “mā dussi”, “mā muyhi”, “mā kilissī”ti niggaṇhātīti?
analyzed: paraḥ parassa cittam mā rajji mā dussi mā muyhi mā kilissi iti niggaṇhāti iti
translated: “Does one person suppress the mind of another, thinking, ‘Don’t be greedy. Don’t be hate-filled. Don’t be deluded. Don’t be agitated’?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Does one person suppress the mind of another?”
“Yes.”

original: Paro parassa uppanno phasso “mā nirujjhī”ti niggaṇhātīti?
analyzed: paraḥ parassa uppannaḥ phassaḥ mā nirujjhi iti niggaṇhāti iti
translated: “Does one person suppress the contact that has arisen in another, thinking, ‘Don’t be stopped’?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

analyzed: paraḥ parassa uppannā vedanā pe  uppannā saññā
translated: “Does one person suppress the feeling …🔽the perception …🔽the volition …
the consciousness …
the faith …
the energy …🔽the mindfulness …
the concentration …

analyzed: uppannā paññā mā nirujjhi iti niggaṇhāti iti
translated: the wisdom that has arisen in another, thinking, ‘Don’t be stopped’?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …
“Does one person suppress the mind of another?”
“Yes.”

“Does one person, for the sake of another, abandon greed …🔽abandon hate …🔽abandon conceit …🔽abandon anger …🔽abandon hostility …🔽abandon contempt …🔽abandon insolence …🔽abandon dishonesty …🔽abandon avarice …🔽abandon deceit …🔽abandon obstinacy …🔽abandon arrogance …🔽abandon vanity …

analyzed: dosam pajahati pe  anottappam pajahati iti
translated: abandon negligence …🔽abandon whatever has arisen, thinking, ‘Don’t be stopped’?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …
Does one person suppress the mind of another?
“Yes.”
“Does one person develop the path for the benefit of another …
develop the foundations of mindfulness …
develop the factors for awakening for the benefit of another?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …
“Does one person suppress the mind of another?”
“Yes.”

original: Paro parassa atthāya dukkhaṁ parijānāti, samudayaṁ pajahati, nirodhaṁ sacchikaroti, maggaṁ bhāvetīti?
analyzed: paraḥ parassa atthāya dukkham parijānāti samudayam pajahati nirodham sacchikaroti maggam bhāveti iti
translated: “Does one person understand suffering, abandon origination, realize cessation, and develop the path for the benefit of another?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …
“Does one person suppress the mind of another?”
“Yes.”

original: Añño aññassa kārako, paraṅkataṁ sukhaṁ dukkhaṁ añño karoti añño paṭisaṁvedetīti?
analyzed: aññaḥ aññassa kārako paraṅkatam sukham dukkham aññaḥ karoti aññaḥ paṭisavedeti iti
translated: “Is one person the doer, and another the feeler of the result? Does one person make suffering and happiness for another?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the eye-consciousness element?” …
“Does one person suppress the mind of another?”
“Yes.”
“Has it not been said by the Blessed One:
‘Evil is done by oneself,
and one is defiled thereby;
Evil is done by oneself,
and one is purified thereby.
Purity and impurity belong to oneself;
no one can purify another.’
“Is there such a suttanta?”
“Yes.”
You shouldn’t say that.
You shouldn’t say that one person restrains the mind of another.
You shouldn’t say that.
You shouldn’t say that one person restrains the mind of another.
You shouldn’t say that.

analyzed: nanu atthi balappattā atthi vasībhūtā ati
translated: But do some people have power and some people have control?

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci atthi balappattā, atthi vasībhūtā, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci atthi balappattā atthi vasībhūtā tena vata re vattabbe
translated: You shouldn’t say that.
Well then, since some people have power and some people have control, you should say that one person restrains the mind of another.
The discussion of restraining is finished.
